page.title: 04Courthill Farm.
page.content: Although the National Trust own most of the land around the Slindon part of our block, Courthill Farm is leased out to Mr. James Langmead. His farm Manager is Mr.Budd, and he employs 10 men.This particular farm has over 10,000 acres, but only a small part of this is in our block.The land is split up into different crops: wheat,barley and grassland for grazing. The farm owns 1,300 pigs,most of which are weaners and 130 milking cows. The heifer calves are kept, but the bull calves are sold for beef at 7 days old. The output of milk is 1,300 gallons per cow per year. It takes 1 hour 20 minutes to milk them. The farm machinery consists of 4 combine harvesters,1 bailer and 11 tractors with attachments. They mill and dry their own food and store it in barns,and they cut and store silage.
